Posted on December 11, 2018             Past News Archive   Click or tap a year to expand.      2018         2018   2/23 – Associate Professor Tolou Shokuhfar published a paper titled “Nanocomposite materials in orthopedic applications” in the Frontiers of Chemical Science and Engineering Journal .  1/9 – The BiAffect App developed by UIC professor Alex Leow is mentioned in Rolling Stone magazine .  1/7 – The BiAffect App developed by UIC professor Alex Leow is covered in an Associated Press article run by The New York Times.  1/4 – Associate Professor Tolou Shokuhfar published a paper titled “Investigation of the magnetosome biomineralization in magnetotactic bacteria using graphene liquid cell – transmission electron microscopy” in Nanoscale Journal .  1/2 – Richard and Loan Hill Professor Ian Papautsky published a paper titled “Isolation of circulating tumor cells in non-small-cell-lung-cancer (NSCLC) patients using a multi-flow microfluidic channel” in the Microsystems & Nanoengineering Journal .  12/19 – Richard and Loan Hill Professor Ian Papautsky received an MPI/R01 Development Award for his Translational Oncology Program proposal.  12/17 – Richard and Loan Hill Professor Xincheng Yao has a study titled “Miniaturized indirect ophthalmoscopy promises an affordable solution to foster smartphone wide-field fundus photography in telemedicine” featured in Advances in Engineering .  12/3 – Minhaj Alam of Dr. Yao’s Biomedical Optics and Functional Imaging Laboratory received the Provost’s Graduate Research Award.  11/29 – Professor Andreas Linninger has a paper titled “Simulations of blood as a suspension predicts a depth dependent hematocrit in the circulation throughout the cerebral cortex” featured in PLoS Computational Biology .  11/21 – Dr. Jie Liang, Professor at UIC Bioengineering, published a paper titled: Probabilistic control of HIV latency and transactivation by the Tat gene circuit  11/17 – Associate Professor Tolou Shokuhfar published a paper titled “Considerations for imaging thick, low contrast, and beam sensitive samples with liquid cell transmission electron microscopy.”  10/15 – Ramille Shah received an NIH R21 grant .  10/12 – The BiAffect App created by Professor Alex Leow is covered in the Wall Street Journal .  9/12 – Richard and Loan Hill Professor Ian Papautsky developed a finger-prick blood test for toxic metals .  9/6 – UIC is ranked among top 10 ‘Best Value’ universities by the Wall Street Journal and Times Higher Education.  9/1 – Richard and Loan Hill Professor Ian Papautsky and collaborator Erin Haynes from the University of Cincinnati) received a $1.7M NIH R33 grant titled “Validation and Demonstration of Point-of-Care Sensor for Multi-Metal Exposure Assessment.”  8/24 – The UIC Engineering World Health (EWH) team won second place in the EWH Design Competition for their design of a hearing test device.  8/1 – Associate Professor Tolou Shokuhfar was accepted into Crain’s Leadership Academy .        2017         2017   12/1 – Gamze Gursoy of the Liang lab received the Annual Outstanding Thesis and Dissertation Award.  12/1 – Shreyan Majumdar of the Klatt lab received the Chancellor’s Graduate Research Award.  12/1 – Wei Tian of the Liang lab received a Provost Deiss Award.  9/27 – Professor Urmila Diwekar was the keynote speaker at the fifth International Summit on Medical Biology and Bioengineering in Chicago.  9/17 – Professor Urmila Diwekar was a speaker at the Symposium on Global Sustainability at Academy of Hungary in Rome.  9/11 – Shresta Patangay of the Hetling lab received an honorable mention in UIC’s 2017 Image of Research competition.  8/30 – Professor Andreas Linninger received a three-year, $297,000 NSF grant for “Computational platform for predictive magnetohydrodynamic drug targeting.”  8/29 – UIC MIE Professor Reza Shahbazian-Yassar and co-investigator Associate Professor Tolou Shokuhfar received a three-year, $390,000 NSF award for “Fundamental Understanding of Growth and Inhibition of Calcium Oxalate Kidney Stones.”  8/24 – Professor Salman Khetani received a three-year, $300,000 NSF grant for “Collaborative Research: High-throughput microliver platform for drug toxicity screening.” This is a collaborative grant with Assistant Professor David Wood of the University of Minnesota Department of Biomedical Engineering.  8/23 – Professor Jie Liang and Co-I Amy Kenter, PhD, of the UIC Department of Microbiology and Immunology in the UIC College of Medicine, received a two-year, $420,000 NIH R21 grant for “Constructing Ensembles of 3D Structures of Igh Locus and Predicting Novel Chromosomal Interactions.”  8/04 – Professor Andreas Linninger and Co-PI Ali Alaraj, MD, of the UIC Department of Neurosurgery, received a two-year, $420,000 NIH R21 grant for “A vascular tree topology inspired platform to compute intracranial blood flow (tree CFD).”  6/30 – Associate Professor Ao Ma received a three-year, $405,000 NSF grant for “Conformational dynamics, reaction coordinates, and time scale separation in biomolecular systems from the perspective of energy flows.”  6/08 – Associate Professor David Eddington received a $416,000 two-year NIH R21 grant for “Confined Genetic Transformation and Exchange of Antibiotic Resistance Genes in Femtoliter Microdroplets.”  5/25 – Ahmed Metwally, a bioinformatics PhD student in the Yang Dai lab , won second place for his poster “Microbiome Dynamics as Predictors of Lung Transplant Rejection” at the Great Lakes Bioinformatics Conference (GLBIO’17) and the Scientific Excellence Award for first-place poster at the UIC Department of Medicine Scholarly Activities Day.  5/22 – Ahmed Metwally, a bioinformatics PhD student co-advised by Yang Dai and David Perkins, received a CCTS Pre-doctoral Education for Clinical and Translational Scientists (PECTS) Fellowship .  5/17 – UIC News story: East Meets West: Engineering, dentistry collaboration leads to new biomaterials .  5/16 – UIC News story: App that tracks bipolar manic, depressive episodes wins award .  4/12 – Clinical Associate Professor Miiri Kotche received a Fulbright award to study in Finland.  4/1 – Nicholas Marjanovic, Kevin Kerr, Ricardo Aranda, and Hananeh Esmailbeigi , who comprise the BMES Tongue-Computer Interface project team, were awarded a VentureWell E-Team Program grant .  3/14 – A UIC bioengineering student was awarded a Gates Cambridge Scholarship .  2/28 – The Engineering World Health team achieved official Performance Certification for Laminar Airflow Equipment from LabMetrics, Inc.  2/21 – Peter Nelson and Alex Leow led a team that developed an app called BiAffect, ­which can monitor mobile device usage to predict manic and depressive moods in people diagnosed with bipolar disorder.  2/14 – Vidyani Suryadevara and Shreya Ghosh received the fall 2016 Chancellor’s Graduate Research Award.  2/13 – The article “Room temperature TiO2 ALD on collagen membrane from a titanium alkylamide precursor” by Christos G. Takoudis, Arghya K Bishal , and Cortino Sukotjo was featured as editor’s pick in JVST .  2/08 – Yawen Ni, Tao Teng , Runting Li, Agnes Simonyi, Grace Y. Sun, and James C. Lee published “TNFα alters occludin and cerebral endothelial permeability: Role of p38MAPK” in PLoS ONE.   1/25 – Divinefavor Osinloye of Tolou Shokuhfar’s lab received the Cato T. Laurencin Travel Fellowship Award.  1/10 – Megan Rexius of David Eddington’s lab received the American Physiological Society Endocrinology & Metabolism Research Recognition Award.        2016         2016   12/2 – Taneka Taylor Jones of the Satish Alapati lab received a Provost Deiss Award for project “Synthesis of a 3D Printed Bioink for Dental Pulp Regeneration.”  11/18 – UIC News story: Miss Chicago Chinatown uses platform to promote girls in STEM .  11/17 – Pritesh Parmar of the James Patton lab received an NIH fellowship for a project titled “Enhancing acquisition of novel motor skills using the optimal error-feedback for robot-assisted stroke rehabilitation.”  11/15 – Ahmed Metwally, who is co-advised by Yang Dai and David Perkins, was elected student representative of IEEE EMBS.  11/10 – A publication by Andreas Linninger and his lab members titled “Hydrocephalus: the role of cerebral aquaporin-4 channels and computational modeling considerations of cerebrospinal fluid” was featured on cover of the September 2016 issue of the Journal of Neurosurgical Focus .  11/4 – Susan Crimmin and David Eddington were appointed to three-year terms on the SLAS Americas Council.  10/24 – Meagan Ouy of Tolou Shokuhfar ‘s lab received an Honors College Undergraduate Conference Travel Grant.  10/18 – Professor Mathew T. Mathew received a new NIH grant titled “Corrosion Induced Hip Implant Failure: Synergistic Interactions of Patient, Material, Design, and Surgical Factors.”  10/17 – BMES students Omar Maldonado and Mohiuddin Ahmed won third place in the AMITA Health Design Challenge in Arlington Heights. Details here.  9/22 – A 2002 PhD graduate won the Pioneers of Miniaturization Prize, which is given every year at microTAS.  9/14 – Members of the Khetani lab published “ Superhydrophobic Coatings with Edible Materials .”  9/7 – Associate Professor Tolou Shokuhfar (PI) and Professor Constantine Megaridis from UIC mechanical and industrial engineering (Co-I) received a three-year, $164,000 grant from the NCSU Nonwovens Institute for “Bacteria-Surface Adhesion Interactions: New Perspectives in Antifouling Surface Design.”  9/1 – David Banner from Tolou Shokuhfar’s lab received the M&M student award of $1,000 from the Microscopy and Microanalysis Society for his work titled “Synthesis and Characterization of Paramagnetic Iron Nanoparticles with Minimal Gold Coating for Optimal Drug Delivery.”  8/26 – Mrignayani Kotecha explores Knee Cartilage Repair .  7/20 – Alex Leow , associate professor of psychiatry and bioengineering, is quoted in an article in The Daily Dot on the use of smartphone apps to help track mood disorders. Leow is team leader for BiAffect, a study that uses a smartphone’s keyboard to track and predict mood episodes in bipolar disorder.  7/19 – Reza Ghodsi from Tolou Shokuhfar’s lab was awarded the IAB 2016 Technical Merit award from the Nonwoven Institute.  7/18 – News story: Hinsdale District 86 students go off campus for real research experience .  7/14 – UIC Distinguished Professor Michael Stroscio received the UIC Award for Excellence in Teaching for the 2016-2017 academic year.  7/4 – News story: Proposed ASTM Standard Will Help Repair Knee Cartilage .  6/29 – Altaf Khan of AVL and Dr. Li of RRC visit a coil-building workshop at the National MagLab site at the McKnight Brain Institute .  6/21 – David Eddington and University of Wisconsin-Madison collaborator David Baum share a $300,000 NSF grant for “EAGER Collaborative Proposal: A microfluidic platform for the discovery of new, life-like chemical systems.”  6/20 – Daniela Valdez-Jasso received a three-year, $228,000 American Heart Association grant for “Ventriculo-vascular coupling in PAH: Significance of large-vessel remodeling on cardiac and pulmonary vascular function.”  6/13 – Dr. O’Neill, Dr. Penn, and students M. Werner and J. Thomas published a featured article in the June 15 edition of Quantitative Imaging for Medicine and Surgery .  6/13 – Associate Professor Tolou Shokhufar and her postdoctoral researcher Emre Firlar’s proposal “Revealing the Evolution of Iron Oxide Crystal Structures in Ferritin Proteins Encapsulated in Graphene via EFTEM and XEDS” was accepted by CNM Argonne .  6/13 – News story: Engineering World Health (EWH) project working in Rwanda, Africa .  5/10 – Miiri Kotche received the 2016 Associate for Women in Science Chicago Area Chapter “Motivator of the Year” Award.  4/29 – Engineering World Health won a $5,000 cash prize at the Maurice Prize Competition for its design of a laminar flow hood for a pediatric hospital in Vietnam.  4/25 – The Tongue-Computer Interface project of BMES was accepted for presentation at the Student Design Competition at the ASAIO 62nd Annual Conference.  4/22 – Bioinformatics student Ahmed Metwally won first place in the 2016 Student Research Forum.  4/20 – Associate Professor Tolou Shokuhfar and her postdoctoral researcher Emre Firlar received $15,000 in CBC Postdoctoral Research Grant Program funding.  1/25 – Dr. Jose Oberholzer’s research was published in Nature Magazine .  1/19 – The job title of biomedical engineer ranked among Chicago’s 10 most in-demand jobs of 2016 , according to Chicago Business .  1/14 – A graduate-level textbook was authored by Jie Liang and Bhaskar DasGupta .        2015         2015   11/25 – Ahmed Metwally won a fall 2015 Chancellor’s Award.  11/9 – Tolou Shokuhfar received a TMS Young Leader Award.  11/4 – News story: Robot can help predict patients’ actions, counteract physical limitations .  10/19 – Justin Horowitz and James Patton are cited in an online article in Smithsonian Magazine about their research .  9/28 – Jose Oberholzer received a new five-year, $540,000 NIH R25 grant titled “Training interdisciplinary scientists for functional cure of diabetes.”  9/28 – Allen Ye’s brain visualization done in CAVE2, part of UIC’s Electronic Visualization Lab, was a finalist in UIC’s 2015 Image of Research Contest.  9/14 – A publication by Sathees Kannan Selvaraj and colleagues from the Takoudis lab in the Journal of Vacuum Science and Technology was among the “Most Read Atomic Layer Deposition Articles Published in 2014.”  7/14 – News story: Goldwater scholar Tiana Wong creates tools to solve health problems .  6/29 – Dr. Urmila Diwekar received the 2015 Energy and Sustainability Award .  5/21 – Student Natalia Lyda was featured on PolvisionNEWS for her Engineering Expo project.  4/21 – Vidyani Suryadevara won a spring 2015 Provost Deiss Award for her project titled “Imaging techniques (MRI) and nanomedicine for the diagnosis and treatment of pulmonary fibrosis.”  4/21 – Michael Mkrtschjan won a spring 2015 Provost Deiss Award for his project titled ‘Training in Micromagnet Fabrication for use in Cardiomyocyte Mechanical load studies.”  4/09 – Vidyani Suryadevara won the UIC Chancellor’s Student Service Award.  2/04 – UIC News story: Students are solving real-world medical problems in the Interdisciplinary Product Development course.        2014 his project “Microfluid Platform for the Study of Cellular and Molecular Water Transport in the Central Nervous System.”  11/05 – C. Knowlton won in the moving image category of UIC’s 2014 Image of Research contest.  10/29 – The Computer and Chemical Engineering Best Paper of the Year 2013 Award was given to Andrej Mosat, Eric Lueshen, Martina Heitzig, Cierra Hall, Andreas Linninger, Gurkan Sin, and Rafiqul Gani for “First Principles Pharmacokinetic Modeling: A Quantitative Study on Cyclosporin.”  10/16 – Jose Oberholzer received two new grants: $385,000 as principal investigator on “Multicomponent microcapsules for allogeneic islet transplantation in a comprehensive, preclinical non-human primate model,” and $1,969,500 as co-PI for “Advanced Biomaterials and delivery systems for Islet Encapsulation.”  8/8 – G.A. Mansoori was appointed to the editorial board of the Journal of Life Science Engineering .  7/30 – Professor Thomas Royston received an NIH award at the Edward C. Nagy New Investigator Symposium.  6/4 – Hananeh Esmailbeigi and Valerie Dobiesz received $40,000 from the UIC Chancellor’s Discovery Fund .  6/4 – Dieter Klatt and Orly Lazarov received $40,000 from the UIC Chancellor’s Discovery Fund .  5/21 – Richard Magin and Carson Ingo were featured in the National High Magnetic Field Lab.  5/7 – The winning team in the bioengineering category at UIC’s Engineering Expo was featured on Univision Chicago .  5/6 – Andreas Linninger received a $300,000 NSF grant for “ Intrathecal magnetic drug targeting. ”  4/30 – G.A. Mansoori joined the editorial boards of Advances in Biomedical Science and Engineering Journal and Journal of Biotechnology and Bioengineering.  4/29 – Carlos Ng received an Abraham Lincoln Fellowship award.  4/11 – Miiri Kotche (PI) and John Hetling (Co-I) received an NIH R25 grant for “Translational Design of Medical Devices.”  4/9 – Kirti Yenkie of the Diwekar lab won the Women and Gender Research Award at the 2014 UIC Research Forum .  3/26 – Farah Shareef of the Michael Cho lab won an FMC Technologies Fellowship .  1/15 – Carson Ingo’s paper was on the cover of Magnetic Resonance in Medicine , 71(2), February 2014.        2013         2013   12/5 – Amit Paul won a gold medal at the UIC College of Medicine 2013 Research Forum.  12/3 – Perlina Fortinberry and Indu Venugopal won 2013 Provost Deiss Research Awards.  11/26 – Farah Shareef and Taneka Jones of the Cho lab won 2013 Chancellor’s Graduate Research Fellowships.  11/14 – CNN Money’s list of Best Jobs In America ranks biomedical engineer in first place.  11/12 – Professor Andreas Linninger was elected director of the AiChE CAST Division for a three-year term.  10/23 – Jie Liang received renewal for the NIH R01 grant titled “Computational Assembly of Beta Barrel Membrane Protein.”  10/21 – Jie Liang and colleagues were awarded a grant from the Chicago Biomedical Consortium.  10/7 – A paper co-authored by Yang Dai about MicroRNA-7 targets was among the most cited according to 2012 Journal Citation Reports.  9/25 – UIC News story: Early diagnostic tool for glaucoma to prevent blindness .  9/24 – UIC News story: Applying quantum dots to cure, diagnose disease .  9/17 – Jun Cheng received a 2013 grant from the Discovery Fund for Multidisciplinary Research.  9/16 – Andreas Linninger and David Eddington won OVCR Ignite Awards for their projects.  9/3 – John Hetling received a POC Award for the Detecting Glaucoma Where it Starts project.  8/16 – Grant Hartung, a student advised by G.A.
